name: market for potato | potato | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/29107/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for 'potato', in the geography of Idaho state in the United States of America.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;The product 'potato' is a root vegetable. It is an annual crop. The ecoinvent database also contains this product from organic and Swiss integrated production.

The activity starts at the gate of potato cultivation farm.

This activity ends with the supply of 'potato', to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0113:Growing of vegetables and melons, roots and tubers

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is the same as stated in the transforming activity for the same reference product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data represent the situation in Idaho state in the United States of America.

exchanges.description:
Potato is transported on average 334 km by lorry >32 metric ton, EURO4 (100%) in the US. Data from 2017 [1; 2]. Potato is not refrigerated transported in the US [3].
References:
[1] Bureau of Transportation Statistics. CFS Preliminary Data. 2017 https://www.bts.gov/surveys/ commodity-flow-survey/2017-cfs-preliminary-data
[2] Ranjan Parajuli, Dave Gustafson, Senthold Asseng, Claudio O. St√∂ckle, John Kruse, Chuang Zhao, Pon Intrapapong, Marty D Matlock, Greg Thoma. Protocol for life cycle assessment modeling of US fruit and vegetable supply chains- cases of processed potato and tomato products. Data in Brief, volume 34.  2021. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.dib.2020.106639.
[3] Parajuli et al., 2021. Protocol for life cycle assessment modeling of US fruit and vegetable supply chains- cases of processed potato and tomato products. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2352340920315195?via%3Dihub#sec0027
